About

Visualizing Public Health Crises

Mapping the Spread of COVID-19

The image below is a COVID-19 global map created by the World Health Organization (WHO). It illustrates the spread of the virus during the early stages of the pandemic. Maps like this were critical for understanding how the virus moved across borders and identifying hotspots where resources were needed most.


Source: WHO COVID-19 Global Map, March 2020

The Role of GIS in Public Health

The video below provides an overview of how Geographic Information Systems (GIS) have been used to track and respond to the COVID-19 pandemic in NY State.

Video: See where COVID-19 spread in New York

About This Project

This project was created as part of GTECH 78534: WebGIS to explore the role of maps in addressing public health crises like COVID-19.
